data.meta_description: Corbin Bleu first burst onto the young Hollywood scene where he starred in Disney Channel's "High School Musical" film series.
data.text:
â€œHigh School Musicalâ€ first sang and danced its way onto the TV screens of every teen and tween more than 15 years ago.

But the Disney franchise is one that just keeps on giving.

Original star Corbin Bleu is making a special guest appearance on Season 3 of Disney+â€™s â€œHigh School Musical: The Musical: The Seriesâ€ â€” and heâ€™s ecstatic to be back.

While the 33-year-old isnâ€™t starring as his character Chad Danforth, heâ€™s actually playing a very exaggerated version of himself.

Bleu recently opened up to People about how coming on the show felt like coming home â€œin many ways.â€

â€œI really went on an emotional roller coaster,â€ the â€œJump Inâ€ star said. â€œWhen this season was coming to an end, I had a moment where I was just watching all of them perform, and it just hit me.â€

â€œHSMTMTSâ€ currently stars a slew of young actors including Olivia Rodrigo, Joshua Bassett, Sofia Wylie and Matt Cornett.

â€œIt hit me like a ton of bricks where Iâ€™m seeing the impact that the original movies had,â€ the Brooklyn native added. â€œThe fact that it even paved the way for this to take place, and the fact that theyâ€™re carrying the torch in such a beautiful way.â€

The â€œHigh School Musicalâ€ series began in 2006, and it subsequently released two sequels in subsequent years. A spinoff film, titled â€œSharpayâ€™s Fabulous Adventure,â€ premiered in 2011.

â€œThe fact that I got to be a part of it again, that I got to actually live in the joy and the magic that is â€˜High School Musicalâ€™ again, I wasnâ€™t expecting it,â€ Bleu said.

â€œHannah Montanaâ€ star Jason Earles as well as Jesse Tyler Ferguson and Jojo Siwa are also making guest appearances in the upcoming season.

Bleu recalled working on the 2006 pilot episode of â€œHannah Montanaâ€ before doing â€œHigh School Musical,â€ adding that he knew Earles, 45, way before meeting his â€œHSMâ€ cast.

â€œIt was just like seeing a long-lost brother. We had so much fun together being able to poke at what the old Disney days were for us, too. Especially the fact that Iâ€™m playing myself and heâ€™s not playing himself,â€ the â€œCatch That Kidâ€ star said.

â€œThat actually added another funny kind of tongue-in-cheek layer of me being able to talk about Jason Earles, the actor, when heâ€™s standing right there but heâ€™s not actually playing Jason Earles,â€ he added.

â€œHigh School Musicalâ€ OGs Zac Efron and Vanessa Hudgens both recently visited East High in Salt Lake City â€” the setting for their Disney Channel films.

â€œDonâ€™t youâ€¦ Forget about me âœŠğŸ¼,â€ the â€œNeighborsâ€ actor, 34, captioned an Instagram post on July 22 that featured him posing in front of the school.

Last month, Hudgens, 33, posted a video of herself taking photos in front of the same school. Fans went a little nutty after the former flames shared snaps of themselves at the place, hoping that an â€œHSMâ€ reunion was possibly in the books.
